snippet: Prime Minister Abdullah Ensour of Jordan said that if the government of President Bashar al-Assad collapsed, Jordan would create “safe havens” for refugees in Syrian territory instead.
abstract: Jordanian Prime Min Abdullah Ensour says his country will not accept thousands of new refugees likely to flee from Syria if Pres Bashar al-Assad’s government collapses; says he will instead deploy special forces troops to create safe havens for refugees inside Syrian territory.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Beirut, and Ranya Kadri from Amman, Jordan.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Abdullah Ensour of Jordan said that if the government of President Bashar al-Assad collapsed, Jordan would create “safe havens” for refugees in Syrian territory instead.

headline.seo: Jordan Says It Won’t Accept Mass Influx of Syrian Refugees
headline.main: Jordan Says It Won’t Accept New Refugees if Syria Falls
headline.print_headline: Jordan Says It Won’t Accept New Refugees if Syria Falls
